instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> usb accessories disabled
threads.message:
the single usb-c port was water damaged, water did not go further inside, even the cable connecting to is not corroded, i replaced the usb connector, now everything works fine but the usb communication, its dis charging fine

when i connect a usb-c stick, which is very low consumption , i get a message that usb accessories disabled, unplug the accessory using too much power 
i replaced that cable going from the port to th eboard anyway, same

i guess the only option i to replace the usb chip? 

is it risky? board works already and customer is willing to accept it without usb communication for cheaper, is it worth the risk to push for it?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> usb accessories disabled
threads.message: well, customer accepted without usb comm, he did not want to risk
